Key Match Events: Rafael Devers' intentional walk by Gerrit Cole with no runners one on sparks Red Sox over Yankees 7-1
Brayan Bello (14-7) gave up one run and four hits in 5 1/3 innings for the Red Sox
Gerrit Cole (6-5) gave up seven runs, his most since June 9, 2022
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Yankee Stadium

The Red Sox closed within 3 1/2 games behind Minnesota for the last AL wild card, also needing to overcome Detroit and Seattle. New York (86-63) saw its AL East lead cut to two games over second-place Baltimore
Others: Zach Penrod, a 27-year-old left-hander, made his big league debut for Boston in the eighth, replacing Josh Winckowski after Aaron Judge’s leadoff double

Boston selected Penrod’s contract from Worcester and recalled left-hander Bailey Horn from the Triple-A farm team. Left-hander Cam Booser and right-hander Zack Kelly were optioned to Worcester after Friday night’s 5-4 loss and catcher Tyler Heineman was designated for assignment
